paragraphs.text:
%md 
# This is a sample Zeppelin notebook to create a pipeline using fluirdb-python-sdk
### Introduction

In this tutorial we are going to analyze a network intrusion events dataset with Python in a Zeppelin Notebook. The Zeppelin Notebook provides an easy and interactive surface for data scientists to explore data through Fluirdb.

follow this link in order to get to know more: https://bit.ly/2J6Y4mY

### Follow inline instructions to know your ways around this notebook and fluirdb-sdk

#### 1. Download the data file

msg.data:
This is a sample Zeppelin notebook to create a pipeline using fluirdb-python-sdk

Introduction

In this tutorial we are going to analyze a network intrusion events dataset with Python in a Zeppelin Notebook. The Zeppelin Notebook provides an easy and interactive surface for data scientists to explore data through Fluirdb.

follow this link in order to get to know more: https://bit.ly/2J6Y4mY

Follow inline instructions to know your ways around this notebook and fluirdb-sdk

1. Download the data file

paragraphs.text:
%sh
wget http://kdd.ics.uci.edu/databases/kddcup99/kddcup.data_10_percent.gz
mkdir -p /tmp/upload
mv kddcup.data_10_percent.gz /tmp/upload/

%md

#### 2. Use fluirdb-sdk to upload a file in fluir setup

msg.data: 2. Use fluirdb-sdk to upload a file in fluir setup

paragraphs.text:
%python
import openapi_client
from openapi_client.rest import ApiException
import time

#Initialization
configuration = openapi_client.configuration.Configuration()
configuration.host = "http://server:8090"
api_instance = openapi_client.ApiClient(configuration)
source_api = openapi_client.SourceApi(api_instance)
pipeline_api = openapi_client.PipelineApi(api_instance)
normal_run_api = openapi_client.PipelineNormalRunApi(api_instance)
exported_table_api = openapi_client.ExportedTablesApi(api_instance)
upload_api = openapi_client.UploadApi(api_instance)

#upload file
resp = upload_api.upload_file("/tmp/upload/kddcup.data_10_percent.gz", "kddcup.data_10_percent.gz")
print(resp)

msg.data: File kddcup.data_10_percent.gz with Name kddcup_347c8faf-75b0-47dc-ad14-378a956bd2d3.data_10_percent.gz uploaded successfully.

paragraphs.text:
%python
# get the path of uploaded file
resp = upload_api.get_uploaded_files_list()
print(resp)

msg.data: {u'result': [{u'files': [], u'uploadTime': u'2019-07-29T07:02:15.241Z', u'name': u'kddcup_347c8faf-75b0-47dc-ad14-378a956bd2d3.data_10_percent.gz', u'path': u'uploads/347c8faf-75b0-47dc-ad14-378a956bd2d3/', u'type': u'csv', u'size': 2144903}]}

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 3. Create a source using the file uploaded

Copy file name from list api response above and use the same for fluir.spark.path

msg.data:
3. Create a source using the file uploaded

Copy file name from list api response above and use the same for fluir.spark.path

paragraphs.text:
%python
# now you can infer the schema of the source file using inline api. while specifying the path add '/user/root' at the begining which is relative dcefs path
src = openapi_client.Body()
src.source_type = "SPARKDATASOURCE"
src.metadata = {"fluir.spark.format":"csv", "fluir.spark.header": False, "fluir.spark.path":"/user/root/uploads/*/kddcup_347c8faf-75b0-47dc-ad14-378a956bd2d3.data_10_percent.gz"}
resp = source_api.infer_schema(src)
schema = resp.result
print(schema)

msg.data: {"type":"struct","fields":[{"name":"_c0","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c1","type":"string","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c2","type":"string","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c3","type":"string","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c4","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c5","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c6","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c7","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c8","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c9","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c10","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c11","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c12","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c13","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c14","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c15","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c16","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c17","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c18","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c19","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c20","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c21","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c22","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c23","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c24","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c25","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c26","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c27","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c28","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c29","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c30","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c31","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c32","type":"integer","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c33","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c34","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c35","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c36","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c37","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c38","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c39","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c40","type":"double","nullable":true,"metadata":{}},{"name":"_c41","type":"string","nullable":true,"metadata":{}}]}

paragraphs.text:
%python
# create a source named 'kddcup' using this file. In file taken into cosideration doesn't have any headers, so you can add your own headers to it while adding the source

kddcup_source = openapi_client.Source()
kddcup_source.source_name = "kddcup"
kddcup_source.metadata = {"fluir.spark.format":"csv", "fluir.spark.header": False, "fluir.spark.path":"/user/root/uploads/*/kddcup_347c8faf-75b0-47dc-ad14-378a956bd2d3.data_10_percent.gz"}
# provide your own schema in inline format
schema = '{\"type\":\"struct\",\"fields\":[{\"name\":\"duration\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"protocol_type\",\"type\":\"string\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"service\",\"type\":\"string\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"flag\",\"type\":\"string\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"src_bytes\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_bytes\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"land\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"wrong_fragment\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"urgent\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"hot\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_failed_logins\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"logged_in\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_compromised\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"root_shell\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"su_attempted\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_root\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_file_creations\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_shells\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_access_files\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"num_outbound_cmds\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"is_host_login\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"is_guest_login\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"count\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"srv_count\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"serror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"srv_serror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"rerror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"srv_rerror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"same_srv_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"diff_srv_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"srv_diff_host_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_count\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_srv_count\",\"type\":\"integer\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_same_srv_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_diff_srv_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_same_src_port_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_srv_diff_host_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_serror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_srv_serror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_rerror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"dst_host_srv_rerror_rate\",\"type\":\"double\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}},{\"name\":\"normal_check\",\"type\":\"string\",\"nullable\":true,\"metadata\":{}}]}'
kddcup_source.data_schema = schema
kddcup_source.source_type = "SPARKDATASOURCE"
resp = source_api.create_source("kddcup", kddcup_source)
print(resp)

msg.data: {'result': 'kddcup'}

paragraphs.text: %md Check the source kddcup and its schema from the 'sources' section of the fluirdb UI

msg.data: Check the source kddcup and its schema from the ‘sources’ section of the fluirdb UI

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 4. Create a pipeline and add source which we created in previous steps to this pipeline

msg.data: 4. Create a pipeline and add source which we created in previous steps to this pipeline

paragraphs.text:
%python
#create a pipeline
pipelineBody = openapi_client.PipelineMetadata()
pipelineBody.auto_schema_refresh = "true"
pipelineBody.description = "kddcup data application"
resp = pipeline_api.create_pipeline("kddcup_pipeline", pipelineBody)
print(resp)

#add source node in pipeline
source_node = openapi_client.SourceNode(source="kddcup", configuration=configuration)
resp = pipeline_api.add_source_node("kddcup_pipeline", "kddcup", source_node)
print(resp)
%md Check the pipeline from the 'ETL Pipelines' section of the fluirdb pipeline

msg.data: Check the pipeline from the ‘ETL Pipelines’ section of the fluirdb pipeline

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 5. Add transform nodes and sink node based on the data processing you want to do on this data

msg.data: 5. Add transform nodes and sink node based on the data processing you want to do on this data

paragraphs.text:
%python
# filter out the normal data
query = "select * from kddcup where normal_check='normal.'"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "normal_data", processor_node)
print(resp)

#sink normal data 
sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "normal_data"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "normal_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)

# filter out the attacked data
query = "select * from kddcup where normal_check!='normal.'"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "attacked_data", processor_node)
print(resp)
#sink attacked data 
sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "normal_data"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "attacked_data_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)
%md

%python
#select distict protocol types from the data which hasn't been attacked
query = "select distinct(protocol_type) from normal_data"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "disctinctProtocols", processor_node)
print(resp)

#select distinct service types from the source
query = "select distinct(service) from kddcup"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "distinct_services", processor_node)
print(resp)

#cartesian product of distinct_protocols and distinct_services
query = "select disctinctProtocols.*, distinct_services.* from disctinctProtocols cross join distinct_services"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "cartesian_product", processor_node)
print(resp)

#sink cartesian product output
sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "cartesian_product"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "cartesian_product_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)

#calculate total normal duration and average normal duration where there was no attack
query = "select sum(duration) as total_normal_duration, avg(duration) as avg_normal_duration from normal_data"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "total_normal_duration_data", processor_node)
print(resp)

sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "total_normal_duration_data"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "total_normal_duration_data_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)

#calculate total attacked duration and average attacked duration where there was an attack
query = "select sum(duration) as total_attacked_duration, avg(duration) as avg_attack_duration from attacked_data"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "total_attacked_duration_data", processor_node)
print(resp)

sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "total_attacked_duration_data"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "total_attacked_duration_data_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)


#create temp df by filterering
query = "select duration, protocol_type, service, flag, src_bytes, dst_bytes from kddcup"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "row_data", processor_node)
print(resp)

#printing schema
resp = pipeline_api.get_node_properties("kddcup_pipeline", "row_data")
print(resp.result.schema)
%md

%python
#query the data from previous node
query = "SELECT duration, dst_bytes FROM row_data WHERE protocol_type = 'tcp' AND duration > 1000 AND dst_bytes = 0"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "query_row_data", processor_node)
print(resp)

#sink the queried data
sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "query_row_data"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "queried_row_data", sink_node)
print(resp)

#try few group by queries to get the expected output
query = "SELECT protocol_type, count(protocol_type) as protocol_count from kddcup where duration> 1000 and dst_bytes=0 group by protocol_type"
processor_node = openapi_client.ProcessorNode(metadata={}, query=query)
resp = pipeline_api.add_processor_node("kddcup_pipeline", "protocol_counts", processor_node)
print(resp)

#sink the data
sink_node = openapi_client.SinkNode()
sink_node.prev_node_name = "protocol_counts"
sink_node.metadata = {"fluir.sink.terminal": "false"}
sink_node.sink_type = "PARQUET"
resp = pipeline_api.add_sink_node("kddcup_pipeline", "protocol_count_sink", sink_node)
print(resp)
%md

%python
#start the pipeline
resp = normal_run_api.start_pipeline("kddcup_pipeline")
print(resp)

msg.data:
{'result': "Success: OpType ' Start Pipeline'. PipelineName: 'kddcup_pipeline' ",
 'status': 'SUCCESS'}

paragraphs.text:
%python
#check the status of the pipeline if the execution has been completed
print(pipeline_api.get_pipeline_state("kddcup_pipeline"))
time.sleep(5)
while pipeline_api.get_pipeline_state("kddcup_pipeline").result != "NotRunning":
    print("pipeline execution in progress")
    time.sleep(5)

print("pipeline execution completed, you can now check the sink data")

msg.data:
{'result': 'NormalModeRunning', 'status': 'SUCCESS'}
pipeline execution in progress
pipeline execution in progress
pipeline execution completed, you can now check the sink data

paragraphs.text:
%python

# Now that the pipeline has finished its execution, you can query the sink data
#check the count of records after cartesian product
resp = normal_run_api.analyze_sink_data("kddcup_pipeline", "select count(*) as cnt from cartesian_product_sink")
print(resp)

%python
#check total attacked duration and average attacked duration
resp = normal_run_api.analyze_sink_data("kddcup_pipeline", "select * from total_attacked_duration_data_sink")
print(resp)

msg.data: {u'total_attacked_duration': 2626792, u'avg_attack_duration': 6.620890601724542}

#check total normal duration and average normal duration
resp = normal_run_api.analyze_sink_data("kddcup_pipeline", "select * from total_normal_duration_data_sink")
print(resp)

%python
#get data from queried_row_data which has duration>1000 and protocol=tcp and dst_bytes=0
resp = normal_run_api.analyze_sink_data("kddcup_pipeline", "select * from queried_row_data")
print(resp)

%python

#get data from queried_row_data which has duration>1000 and protocol=tcp and dst_bytes=0
resp = normal_run_api.analyze_sink_data("kddcup_pipeline", "select * from protocol_count_sink")
print(resp)

msg.data: {u'protocol_count': 139, u'protocol_type': u'tcp'}

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 6. Delete the pipeline and source node

msg.data: 6. Delete the pipeline and source node

paragraphs.text:
%python
resp = pipeline_api.delete_pipeline("kddcup_pipeline")
print(resp)
time.sleep(30)
resp = source_api.delete_source("kddcup")
print(resp)
